bug.author: cyrilthank
bug.summary: Kubeflow Central Navigation UI browser does not open at 8080 or 31380
bug.description:
/kind bug After running the steps in <denchmark-link:https://ubuntu.com/kubeflow/install>https://ubuntu.com/kubeflow/install</denchmark-link>
kubectl cluster-info Kubernetes master is running at <denchmark-link:https://10.0.2.15:6443>https://10.0.2.15:6443</denchmark-link>
KubeDNS is running at <denchmark-link:https://10.0.2.15:6443/api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/services/kube-dns:dns/proxy>https://10.0.2.15:6443/api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/services/kube-dns:dns/proxy</denchmark-link>
To further debug and diagnose cluster problems, use 'kubectl cluster-info dump'. What steps did you take and what happened: [A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] I am not able to access the UI at port 31380 What did you expect to happen: access the UI at port 31380 Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kubectl version Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T11:13:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T11:05:50Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.6.2-0-g47a0e4c7

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.96. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

kubectl -n kubeflow describe pod centraldashboard-7b69b696cb-44x6k returns cyril@master-node:~$ kubectl -n kubeflow describe pod centraldashboard-7b69b696cb-44x6k Name: centraldashboard-7b69b696cb-44x6k Namespace: kubeflow Priority: 0 Node: Labels: app=centraldashboard kustomize.component=centraldashboard pod-template-hash=7b69b696cb Annotations: Status: Pending IP: Controlled By: ReplicaSet/centraldashboard-7b69b696cb Containers: centraldashboard: Image: gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/centraldashboard:v0.6.0-rc2 Port: 8082/TCP Host Port: 0/TCP Environment: Mounts: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount from centraldashboard-token-ms9z9 (ro) Conditions: Type Status PodScheduled False Volumes: centraldashboard-token-ms9z9: Type: Secret (a volume populated by a Secret) SecretName: centraldashboard-token-ms9z9 Optional: false QoS Class: BestEffort Node-Selectors: Tolerations: node.kubernetes.io/not-ready:NoExecute for 300s node.kubernetes.io/unreachable:NoExecute for 300s Events: Type Reason Age From Message <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Warning FailedScheduling 48s (x129 over 3h10m) default-scheduler 0/1 nodes are available: 1 node(s) had taints that the pod didn't tolerate.
kubectl -n kubeflow logs -p centraldashboard-7b69b696cb-44x6k does not return any output
Please advise if there is any logs gathering for kubernetes which i can use to get the logs uploaded

Firstly is your dashboard pod running, description above shows as pending. Secondly are you on ubuntu machine and installed kubeflow in the same machine itself, so that you can localhost into kubeflow UI ?

stalled kubeflow in the same machine itsel
Yes , I also got this issue. My all pods and services are running under kubeflow namespace but we are still stuck at dashboard UI part. My machine is Ubuntu 18.04 and Kubeflow and minikube is up and running but not KF UI. Thanks

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link> if your still having trouble per <denchmark-link:https://github.com/anupash147>@anupash147</denchmark-link> suggestion could you please look into why the pods are stuck in the pending state. i.e. do a I would al suggest trying the latest 0.7.0 release.
